Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of lip, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip reserved; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9A or Type 9B South Ionian cup with everted rim. The types closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 51, no. 177)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.503) (Phase 3)
